revised_title: Analyzing Alternating-Current Machine Instability and Hunting Phenomenon
tldr: This article discusses the hunting phenomenon in alternating-current machines, where machines tend to develop oscillations and lose synchronization. The author explains the causes of this instability, such as resonance and external disturbances, and provides a mathematical analysis of the oscillations and their damping. The article also suggests methods to improve the stability of alternating-current machines, like using damping coils or "amortisseurs."
